result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert John Ness was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Robert John Ness was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack September 21, 2018

-Concurrent
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:

To get into Chippewa Valley Treatment Center if a bed is available.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Andrew Martin Nelson   DF:  Robert John Ness appeared from jail. Includes 16CF37, 17CF350 and 17TR3485. Case called at 11:09 am. ADA Minser recites agreement. Atty Nelson makes statement. Court questions. Court enters Conviction in Count #1 in 16CF37.    Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Count #1 in 17CF350. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court uses attached report to establish facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Count #1 in 17CF350. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses remaining Counts in 17CF350 and 17TR3485. Sentencing arguments. 
On 17CF350, Crt orders: 2 yrs i/c, 3 yrs e/s
- Court Costs $1200.00
- DNA Sample and Surcharge  $200.00; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- 30 month rev with credit for adminstrative suspension
- 36 month IID
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

Credit for 225 Days

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Robert John Ness appeared. Includes 16CF37 and 16TR525. Attorney Kucinski recites agreement. Court reviews constitutional rights with defendant and felony conviction. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for counts 1 (Posses Meth) and 4 (OWI 4th). Def pleads no contest to cts 1 and 4. Court uses complaints/reports and Prelim hearing as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count 4. Court dismisses counts 2 and 3; count 5 is merged and dismissed. Court dismisses 16TR525. Court stays adjudication of count 1 pending compliance with 18 month deferred agreement to run concurrently with probation. Court reviews agreement; approves and signs. 
Court orders for count 4 - S/W 18 month probation with conditions: 
- 60 day in St. Croix County Jail with good time and 4 days credit. Defendant is approved to serve the remaining 41 days by electronic monitering through Sun Monitoring; to begin July 8, 2016.
- Fine of $1744.00. Apply bond on file and pay remainder through Clerk of Court. Defendant to meet with payment clerk. 
- AODA and recommended follow through
- 30 month drivers license revocation
- 30 month ignition interlock
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.


Sign up for probation today, July 1, 2016. Bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
